page.title: 16Hunting,Lorton/Whinlatter
page.content: Just outside Lorton are the{kennels where the{Melbreak Hunt}keep their dogs.It is a{fell pack,}which means it is lead{on foot}by the{hunts-man,}who also lives at the kennels. The{season}starts after the third Thursday in{September,}when the dogs are brought to Loweswater Show.They hunt from then until the end of {lambing season,}when the dogs are returned to their owners for the summer. There are 43{hounds}and 4{terriers. They hunt{three times a week,}but if the scent is poor,due to bad weather, they don't always catch a fox.In the 84/85 season,{59 foxes}were killed. The Melbreak covers an area from Buttermere to Cockermouth and from Whinlatter across to Ennerdale, although this is the{smallest district of any of the{six}Lakeland fell packs.
